German

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Middle High German wƒÅfen, from Old High German wƒÅfan (compare Yiddish ◊ï◊ï◊ê÷∏◊§÷ø◊ü (vofn)), from Proto-West Germanic *wƒÅpn, from Proto-Germanic *wƒìpnƒÖ. Cognate with Dutch wapen, English weapon, Danish v√•ben, Swedish vapen, Gothic êçÖêå¥êçÄêåΩ (wƒìpn). Doublet of Wappen (‚Äúcoat of arms‚Äù), which is borrowed from Low German.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /Ààvaf…ô/
  • Audio (Austria):(file)
  • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)
  • Rhymes: -af…ô
  • Hyphenation: Waf‚Äßfe

Noun

[edit]

Waffe f (genitive Waffe, plural Waffen)

  1. weapon, arm

Declension

[edit]
Declension of Waffe [feminine]
singular plural
indef. def. noun def. noun
nominative eine die Waffe die Waffen
genitive einer der Waffe der Waffen
dative einer der Waffe den Waffen
accusative eine die Waffe die Waffen
